definition: see 一往無前|一往无前[yi1 wang3 wu2 qian2]
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.chinese: 因为生活本来就是一往直前的。

sentences.english: East China Sea mighty waves surges forward, the wave of our reform rushes ahead.
sentences.chinese: 东海波涛汹涌澎湃，改革大浪一往直前。

sentences.english: It is unstopping exploration, until you exhaust money or pressure.
sentences.chinese: 它是一往直前的探索，直到你没钱或者断气。

sentences.english: I just went ahead and did it.
sentences.chinese: 我只是一往直前的去做了。

sentences.english: Be sure you're right then go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 确信是准确的，就一往直前。

definition: lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
see 百折不撓|百折不挠[bai3 zhe2 bu4 nao2]
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to sweep everything before one/to be invincible (idiom)
